Text: Could you, please, name them *.deltaiso? Now it looks alike *.disc

ogneyar: I've been using using .diso for two reasons: 1) Fedora uses .drpm for deltarpms, and 2) the first 4 characters of a deltaiso file are DISO (the file command uses this to identify the file type - it's recognized in F13 and up).
Also, deltarpms and deltaisos are often referred to as drpms and disos, resp.
